thread.title: British doctor denied entry to the US under new travel ban | Central
thread.title_full: British doctor denied entry to the US under new travel ban | Central - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: British doctor denied entry to the US under new travel ban | Central
text:
A cardiologist from Leicester says she was not allowed to fly from Heathrow to America because she has an Iraqi stamp in her passport.
Dr Abtehale Al Hussaini, who is a British Citizen, was on her way to a conference in Washington and says she has never had a problem before.
She claims airport staff weren't able to identify why she was denied entry despite having travelled to the US on the same passport a year beforehand.
It comes after President Trump introduced controversial travel bans on people from seven, mainly Muslim, countries last week.
Read more: Leicester City Mayor says Trump 'not welcome here' Dr Al-Hussaini says she felt singled out because of her name and was left feeling humiliated.
I'm absolutely disappointed, very much disgusted. This is not how anybody should be treated, I speak for myself, for my colleagues,for many academics, we all travel back and forth across the Atlantic, to share our data, to collaborate with researchers, This is not the way forward.
â€“ Dr Al-Hussaini The Home Office say they can't comment specifically on Dr Al-Hussaini's, but they did tell us there has been no change to UK immigration rules.
Read more: Widespread protest over Trump travel ban Last updated Fri 3 Feb 2017 East Midlands Leicester
